worklogs.comment:
seddonm1 commented on pull request #9399:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9399#issuecomment-772000387


   @Dandandan :+1:
   
   I saw from the release notes we may support Decimal128 now? if so all `DataType:: Float64` can be converted so the rounding errors are eliminated and we can safely compare against the expected results.


----------------------------------------------------------------

Dandandan commented on pull request #9399:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9399#issuecomment-772006248


   @seddonm1 that certainly makes sense, maybe we should do that in another PR?
   
   AFAIK we don't have have the TPCH data currently also in the CI, right?
   In that case this PR still helps to avoid regressions (and to avoid bugs with empty data, like we can see now in all queries except 1 and 6.

seddonm1 commented on pull request #9399:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9399#issuecomment-772008078


   @Dandandan yes these queries rely on first generating the TCP-H data by running the tool generated here: https://github.com/databricks/tpch-dbgen
   
   Given that you have to clone the repository to create the data I thought it would be reasonable to use their answers which are also contained in the repository.

Dandandan commented on pull request #9399:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9399#issuecomment-772015418


   @seddonm1 yes, sure, that's very useful too, and I tested them indeed earlier to see that only 1 of the queries "validates" because of the rounding errors. So would also be very nice to see if we can fix / validate that too!
   
   Maybe at some point, would also be cool to have the CI validating the queries based on the data as well :)
